intro: Alstroemeria dentata, commonly known as the toothed alstroemeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, grass-like leaves. Its roots are fibrous, and it prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Alstroemeria dentata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
